course_description: This course will cover various aspects of state and local government, including: creation, financing, and dissolution of municipalities; political participation; the relationship between local, state, and federal governments and the courts; governmental interests, powers, functions and liability; roles in economic development and public-private partnerships. Significant themes include: democracy, land use, race, class, and federalism.
sections: Class Nbr: 5591, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 2-3:30p, Instructor: T. Montague, Status: Open
